reviews.review_msg: A reasonably amiable prof that attempted to make the course material engaging, yet her unrealistic emphasis with regards to originality that she demanded amongst the class was unwarranted, even for a 4th year SFU history course. Adcock's class is definitely not a GPA booster, as her marking was harsh based on her seemingly unattainable standards.

The course had 3 papers that were marked by our TA, and we received feedback in a timely manner so we could apply corrections to the next paper. The final was a written/in-class essay marked by Tina. She is super kind and considerate, providing a reasonable amount of homework and time in some tutorials to complete work

Taking this 100 level class as a second year student, and felt it was more like a 400 level regarding the difficult marking, extensive essay prompts in little word counts and final exam set up. TA and Tina contradicted criteria and gave out key information after assignments were graded, and weren't open to discussion about grade changes.

Tina honestly seemed nice but honestly the course put a really sour taste in my mouth. The syllabus changed throughout the course (Tardy marks, grading weights, etc). The TA seemed to have a specific answer in mind for each assignment and wasn't open to other interpretations. Also was told "no one would receive above a B-". NOT A GPA BOOSTER

This rating is for HIST 200
Very accommodating regarding extensions, and provides good feedback. She is nice, but depending on the student she is talking to, she can be condescending which is very weird. She is a very hard marker, not a GPA booster class. Seems to find an issue with assignments every time, even if you do what she suggests.
Fantastic Professor. Engaging lectures, forgiving deadlines, clear expectations, and very approachable.

There's not much else I can say about her. She is very good with granting extensions- in fact she provides them immediately on release of the assignment, with no penalties. If you're someone with ADHD or similar, I highly recommend.
Her lectures were engaging and I never left class without feeling like I'd learned something.
Great prof. she really cares about her students and clearly enjoys teaching. She is also very approachable and accommodating for extensions, questions, and general concerns. Highly recommend

This is the second time I had Dr. Adcock as a prof. Though this was a 400 level class, I must say she had high expectations and made me work for my grade. That being said, I am so glad I took this environmental history class with her. Her passion for this subject is evident, and on top of this, she cares for her students a ton! Marking  fair!
One of the best professors I have come across, wish I had taken more courses with her during my undergrad. She gives clear expectations and helpful feedback.

Super Passionate. Great professor. If you need help, she was willing to help. Gave great feedback on assignments. Course content was kind of bland, but she tried to make it as interesting as possible.
Course is poor design. Marking criteria is ambiguous. I would not recommend this course

Conflicted about my view towards this class. Tina is very nice/approachable and I found the course material interesting - but despite this interest and overall effort, I  shockingly ended up with the lowest mark I've ever gotten. Ended up with A's in my other 2 classes this sem even though I prioritized this one? Guess it just wasn't my class.

Adcock was a good professor. She was kind &  wanted to help students succeed. However, the content of this course was quite dry and repetitive: most of it was on the fur trade & there wasn't much post-WWI. For the final paper, I would recommend speaking to her about your thesis & sources as she is looking for a very specific & original argument.

Dr. Adcock is an excellent prof! Highly recommended. Very helpful and friendly. 323 doesn't necessarily have the most interesting content but she manages to make it entertaining. Workload and readings were reasonable for a 300 level class. Mark was based on the final exam, a book review, longer term essay, and tutorial participation. No midterm.

I took it in the fall and it was one of the best courses I've taken.  She is extremely helpful and personable.  You only have to read one or two articles each week. Lectures are easy to follow and listen to. The grading criteria is crystal clear and if you work hard, you will do well. I would take another class with her in a heartbeat!

In my fourth year and she is by far my favourite professor. She really cares about her students and is very responsive to student feedback. Despite it being Canadian history, her class is extremely interesting and she chooses very unique and engaging readings. She is crystal clear and eloquent in her explanations. Definitely take classes with her!

Prof. Adcock's passion for Canadian history is contagious. 'The Canadian Prairies' had the potential to be quite a dry course, but she made the subject matter engaging. All lectures were well organized and packed with information; hand cramps from writing were a common occurrence. Prof. Adcock is kind and wants her students to succeed!

LOVE her. She knows her stuff and makes Canadian history interesting. Don't miss lecture, she always goes over different material than the readings. Course content is super interesting. She is always clear on what she expects, and basically tells you exactly what's going to be tested. Will take again. HIGHLY recommend taking a class with her.

Really works to ensure that all voices are heard/respected in tutorial, and times her lectures well enough to allow for longer questions if they're needed. She seems flexible if you must miss a tutorial (I asked if I could write a response instead b/c of a family emergency). Get started on the book review early. Lots of reading there. Only buy one!

Very approachable, makes Canadian History fun. Passion and hard work will lead to success.  Study tips... 1. Discuss the material with friends and family. It'll really help you remember all the information. 2. Take notes on every article under themes presented in lecture. These notes will be invaluable for tutorials and the final.
Best course I've ever taken.

One of the best history profs I've had at SFU! She was very willing to hear students' input, which is hard to come by. She did an awesome job of keeping the class interested in course content, used a variety of sources, and was very approachable.  I highly recommend her as a prof!
